title: 115_s470
content: The "Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2017" enhances the child and dependent care tax credit. The "Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2017" increases the applicable percentage for adjusted gross income, raises the dollar limit on the creditable amount, and includes an adjustment for inflation in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2017" includes an inflation adjustment provision for dollar amounts in subsection (c) starting from 2019. The dollar amount for the Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $100. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make the credit refundable and to restructure certain sections. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including changing references from "this chapter" to "this subtitle" and updating specific section numbers throughout. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including changing references and updating specific section numbers. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include changes to section 36C for household and dependent care expenses necessary for gainful employment. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2017.
